# Pixel-level Transforms and Targets

Pixel-level transforms (also known as image-only transforms) change only the input image and leave any additional
targets such as masks, bounding boxes, and keypoints unchanged.

These transforms are useful when you want to modify the appearance of an image without affecting the position or
shape of objects within it. For example, you might want to adjust the brightness, contrast, or color of an image,
or add noise to it.

## List of Pixel-level Transforms

You can apply any of these transforms to any target, and under the hood, the transform will change only the input
image and return any other input targets such as masks, bounding boxes, or keypoints unchanged.

- [AdditiveNoise](https://explore.albumentations.ai/transform/AdditiveNoise)
- [AdvancedBlur](https://explore.albumentations.ai/transform/AdvancedBlur)
- [AutoContrast](https://explore.albumentations.ai/transform/AutoContrast)
- [Blur](https://explore.albumentations.ai/transform/Blur)
- [CLAHE](https://explore.albumentations.ai/transform/CLAHE)
- [ChannelDropout](https://explore.albumentations.ai/transform/ChannelDropout)
- [ChannelShuffle](https://explore.albumentations.ai/transform/ChannelShuffle)
- [ChromaticAberration](https://explore.albumentations.ai/transform/ChromaticAberration)
- [ColorJitter](https://explore.albumentations.ai/transform/ColorJitter)
